title: please can you identify this font?
content:
Hi i would be most grateful of any help identifying the font used here for FUSE magazine.  
cheers

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080125221449im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Fuse%20Logo_3662_6427.jpg)

 [‹ Slab Serif: Ad Art Design headings](http://web.archive.org/web/20080125221449/http:/typophile.com/node/41137 "Go to previous forum topic") [Type ID ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080125221449/http:/typophile.com/node/40924 "Go to next forum topic")
author: kel86

comments.content: I believe this was drawn by [Neville Brody](http://web.archive.org/web/20080125221449/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Neville%252BBrody) specifically for the FUSE logo, not from any font. You might like his [FF Typeface Six](http://web.archive.org/web/20080125221449/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_typeface_six/), though the ’S’ is very different.
It was Neville Brody. I believe it might have been issued as a font in the early 90s by FontShop.
thanks for your reply, this typeface has been suggested to me before but like you said the S is very different. Every other letter could quite easily be Typeface six bar the S.

[Gotham Ultra](http://web.archive.org/web/20080125221449/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_styles.php?itemID=200059&variantTypeID=&cpuCount=&productLineID=100008) has some similarities if you are looking for that.
thanks i will check it out

Or you can click through the listmasters necessary list [Extra Bold, Ultra Black Fonts: Hit Hard with Heavy Duty Typ](http://web.archive.org/web/20080125221449/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontfeed/archives/extra-bold-ultra-black-fonts/). And take a look at [Zine Sans Display Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20080125221449/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Zine%20Sans%20Blk) for another possibility.
